content.question:
Compluribus navibus fractis, reliquae cum essent funibus, ancoris, reliquisque

armamentis amissis ad navigandum inutiles, magna, id quod necesse erat accidere,

totius exercitus perturbatio facta est. Neque enim naves erant aliae quibus reportari

possent, et omnia deerant quae ad reficiendas naves erant usui et, quod omnibus

5constabat hiemari in Gallia oportere, frumentum his in locis in hiemem provisum

non erat.

Bellum Gallicum 4. 29

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. In lines 1-3 (Compluribus . . . facta est), which three Latin words identify what the Roman fleet has lost?

2. In this passage, which two Latin words identify the Roman army’s response to the situation?

3. (A) What are the number and case of quibus (line 3) and (B) to which Latin word does it refer?

4. Who or what is the implied subject of possent (line 4) ?

5. (A) What are the tense and voice of oportere (line 5) ? (B) Identify the use of the infinitive.

6. In lines 3-6 (Neque . . . non erat), which four Latin words indicate that the Roman army did not have an adequate supply of food?

7. (A) Identify the one perfect tense verb in this passage and (B) translate it in context.

8. (A) Identify one dative noun in this passage and (B) identify its use.

9. In Book 1, under what circumstances did Ariovistus become involved in the affairs of Gaul? Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
